newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel demands Palestinian Authority pay up.
newsitem.headline: Israel demands Palestinian Authority pay up.

text.p: Israel demanded on Sunday the Palestinian Authority settle a 75 million shekel ($23 million) bill with Israeli utilities and other state-owned companies, the Treasury said.

"The Palestinian Authority (PA) promised to respond within 24 hours to the Treasury's demand it pay its debt to Israeli companies," the Treasury said in a statement issued after director-general David Brodet met a Palestinian delegation.

It said the PA, in charge of Palestinian self-rule areas in the West Bank and Gaza, owed the money to service providers such as Bezeq Israel Telecom, Israel Electric Corp, the Mekorot water company and Jerusalem's Hadassah hospital.
PA officials were not immediately available for comment.
"The Treasury's demand for immediate settlement of the Palestinian Authority's debts is a matter of principle," the statement said.
The PA cabinet statement on Friday accused Israel of withholding "70 million shekels of the Palestinian Authority's tax money from last month as part of the siege on the Authority".
An Israeli treasury spokeswoman refused to comment on the withholding.

The Authority has complained frequently of economic hardship stemming from Israeli closures of the West Bank and Gaza and delays in the dispatch of international donor money pledged to self-rule areas.
